transcript.content: An Honest Mistake by The Bravery on Xfm 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais. With me: Stephen Merchant and Karl Pilkington.
Yeah.
Our producer.
All right?
In inverted commas, Heat put.
Yeah.
Yeah, well they know, they know. How are you doing, all right Karl?
Yeah, didn't they also write something about me... Bald round head?
Yes, perfectly round little bald man head, they said, so.
Yeah 'cause you need to know that when you listen to the radio and that.
Ricky snorts
Really matters what my hair's doing.

Your hair, have you given it a little sort of polish? 'Cause you look like a cue ball and you've had a shave and it. I've never seen such a round head. It looks, it actually looks like a plate with ears.
Yeah. Well for those that have never seen Karl, I actually, if you remember, I think he looks a little bit like Mr. Spoon from Button Moon.
Ricky laughs
He does! He does!
If you've ever seen that show--

And also he looks like, you know when they say they find a little four-foot human and it's actually half a million years old and they give it a name. It's the first you know, Australopithecus into, right? He looks like one of them as well.
Perfectly round little, he's the missing link. He looks half human, half monkey.
'Cause he's got a slight slouch as well.
Yeah.
It's like those pictures where you see it going from an ape to a man. It's like he's somewhere in the middle.

Yeah and of course his monkey hands. His hairy little wrists, those little, like those skinny little things that he can get oranges out of holes with and it's unbelievable. Why are you so all shaved and polished and everything?
Got a wedding.
What?
Got to go to a wedding today, so... thought I'd, you know, clean myself up a bit.
Shouldn't you be wearing a suit or something?
No, I'll go home and put something on.
Oh, okay.
But yeah, Suzanne said, "Go on, make an effort." So I've had a shave and that and then she, I came out the bathroom and she said, "Oh, your head looks a bit sort of egg-ish."
Ricky and Steve laugh
She's right.
She always worries about when I have a shave because I just, you know what I mean?
That's your girlfriend, Karl.
I know.
Saying that. Just think, so don't worry about Heat saying it. The funny thing is, it's Boyd Hilton I think, of Heat, that wrote it.
And he's got a little bald head.
You know, they don't slag him off.
Yeah but on the end of his review, does it say, you know, "Written by Baldy Boyd." No 'cause it doesn't matter, it's a magazine. Don't worry about it.
Looking forward to the wedding?
Karl sighs
Bit boring, innit? But you've gotta do it.
Ricky laughs
They're probably listening! Shall we do a shout out?
No, it'll be a great day for them but I know what will happen: Suzanne will see, you know, all the fuss and that and she'll get ideas and I'll have to let her down and all that.
Why is it you don't wanna get married, again? I always forget.
It's just... Who's it for, at the end of the day? I've been with Suzanne for 11 years, right?
Sure.
We're happy. Well, I am.
Ricky laughs
Yeah and that's the thought that counts.
You're never happy!
I am, I'm all right.

Yeah, I know you're happy with Suzanne and everything but apart from that, you're never happy. You are the most grumpy, moany thing in the world. I mean, I get annoyed but I'm always happy. I was annoyed here, I was happy coming here but there was a bloke behind me walking and scuffing his feet, he had a pair of those stupid Scholls on and he was clicking and scuffing. Wear some shoes you don't have to click, pick your feet up! Flip flops annoy me, you know? But I'm ha--

...I'm just annoyed. You are just like "Uhh, the worlds on me. It's rubbish, this." I know the world's great, it's just sometimes people annoy me by being there. You know, but uhh... Steve said I should be locked in one of those towers that princesses used to be.
In fairytales.
In fairytales. Because eveyrthing annoys me. Umm. But you are... You're grumpy.
I'm not. I'm alright.
Oh, right. Okay. Listen, we're gonna play a record uhm... Soon. But uhm... Coming up, Steve. I went away with Karl.
Interesting.

Okay? It was a little present from Jane. It was a golfing day, I could take someone... Took Karl. Brilliant day. Absolutely, absolutely brilliant. But it ended with us sort of drinking and chatting and me saying "Right, I'm going to bed." 'Cause Karl said the most ridiculous thing he has ever said. Think of that!
That's something!
Oh... Sometimes Karl, I think you're on another planet. Here's The Only Ones.

metadata.song_track: Another Girl, Another Planet - 2008 re-mastered version

transcript.content: The Only Ones - Another Girl, Another Planet
"Another Girl, Another Planet" by The Only Ones. What a song!
Amazing.
One of my favourite intros, ever. Uhm... Dr. Fox disagreed with me, his favourite ever was err... I think "Money for Nothing", if I remember correctly.
Interesting! Another great tune!
Yeah... Yeah. Another great... Another great tune. *inaudible*
Yeah. I'f you'd like to let us know what your favourite intro of all t- *snoring*
Ricky laughs
That number again is 0... For f... Right! Well, we've got so much to get through in this show.
Sorry, let me just get this right. I don't quite understand. You were given a gift, and the gift was a golfing... A day of golf.
A golfing day. And, and... Err, yeah. For my Christmas present. A part of my Christmas present from Jane. Uhm, err... A night away, uhm... Two rooms, two rounds of golf, dinner for two, right? Err...
Mmm. But... But not with her, I notice.
Well, she doesn't play... No. She knew... No... *mumbling* ...playing golf. It was a... It was a golfing day and she doesn't play golf, so uhm... I had to choose someone to err, uhm... Take away.
Sure, sure.
It's alright, it wasn't a romantic meal.
No, no... That was my immediate thought. I was...
Ricky laughs
Yeah. Me and Karl, just getting in there, in the jacuzzi together.
Yeah. It just sounds like an excuse for Jane to have a day off from you!
Ricky laughs
"But you don't play golf, Jane!" "I know, I know! Go!"
"Go, go!" Yeah, yeah!
"Go! Enjoy yourself!"
A bowling ball with my name on it.
Yeah.

Uhm... So... Chose Karl, obviously. Uhm, err... We went there, it was a great day, wasn't it? Brilliant round of golf. Absolutely brilliant, such a beautiful place in Stoke Poges, like, a really posh place.
And does... Are you a good golf err... A good golf player?
Err... Well, we'll get to that.
Ricky laughs
Oh, okay. Blimey!
Well, we err... He bought... He bought the shoes especially for it.
Oh, brilliant. I'd loved to have seen him in those little shoes.

I know. And they were no good 'cause they were metal spikes. We had to change them. He was annoyed, straight away. He's... He spent over twenty-two pounds on these... These golf shoes. Err... We hired a buggy, that was brilliant fun! I was bombing along, wasn't I?
Mmm.
I don't drive, but I... I just... It was great on that buggy. Well, you've been on a buggy with me and you were a bit scared.
Terrified. Yeah.
Well, wha... I nearly killed us once! I was just-
Taking banks and things but you don't see sort of bunkers and he'd scream and go, "Stop!" and he'd put his foot down on the brake and then when, I reversed--

At one point he sort of did a handbrake turn next to the lake and then we had, we had to reverse, right? And you know how you just flick a switch and put your foot down? He did that without looking. I look behind, there's a big oak tree there.
He screams, "Watch the tree!" Right? He was, he was--
No. Dukes of Hazzard.
Ricky laughs
He did! And I kept jumping in and leaving him behind because I like to go to my ball 'cause anyway.

Um, so the first shot, the first shot, I got out my driver. I honestly did one of the best shots I've ever done, it went straight down, it was great. I thought, "Phew, got away with that," 'cause it's always the first one, 'cause there's the clubhouse and you want to look good. So he dings that back and I'd been saying, "Buy some balls." He'd just got six balls. I was going, "What if you lose them?" "I won't lose six balls, right?" He gets, tees out, right? Whacks it. It goes miles, like right angles, straight into these, the woods, right? He turns round and he goes, "Go and buy some more balls."

So I'm laughing 'cause it's like, impolite to laugh but he broke the ice for me and I went full around and then second shot I go, "You know you're for three now? If you take another shot." He went, "Ugh." All right, so it was his third shot, he puts the ball down.
Ricky laughs
He hits the ground before it and misses the ball altogether and I was on my back, wasn't I?
Ricky laughs
Unbelievable.
Actually rolling about on his back.
Rolling about on my back and we were terrible. I went round 107, he went round in like, 119 or summat. It was just rubbish!
How long did it take?
Five hours.
Of course.
And there was no one around luckily.
Yeah, yeah.

But it was fantastic. So then we go and have our meal. What annoys me, I said "Right, I'll go for a run," he went, "I'll have a bath." I said, "I'll see you at quarter to eight." At five to eight I have to call him. He's not ready, so he's let me down there. Well, you know, I can't stand lateness or laziness--
He hates lateness.
Yeah, and he's let me down. Do you know his excuse? He fell asleep in the bath 'cause there was no light bulb.
There was no light bulb in the bathroom, so he fell asleep?
So instantly fell asleep and he was late.
No, do you know what I mean though, Steve? If you're sort of like, nice and warm and what have you. I was tired anyway, I'd been stressed out for four and a half hours, right?
Right!
Me life flashed in front of me a few times in that buggy.
Ricky laughs

So it all sort of wears you down a bit. I thought, "Right, I've got headache. You're going for your run. I'm gonna have a bath." I walk in, put the light on. For some reason it didn't come on but I thought, "It's all right, I'll just uh, you know, doesn't matter. You can have a bath in the dark."
It's summer, so it's light anyway.
Well, there's no windows in the bathroom, so...
So you're in the darkness.

So I'm in the darkness. I nod off 'cause I'm shattered. He calls up hassling me. So I say, "Well, I won't, it doesn't normally take that long for me because you know, I haven't got like long hair I've gotta dry. I can sort of, one wipe."
Yeah, he's already 10 minutes late though when I called.
Of course.
Well, 10 minutes.
Mm, well, lateness is lateness, next?
Doesn't matter. Dinner wasn't till quarter past, so we had like, another 20 minutes anyway. So it doesn't really matter.
Yeah, but we said quarter to.
So he's calling up, "Hurry up, hurry up." So I said, "Yeah, all right."
So I get out. I'm drying like, my tackle and what have you. He calls back again 30 seconds later.
Did you stop to have a quick feel? Because, you know.
No, I don't really like that.
No? You're not gonna do that then.
Give it a wipe. 30 seconds later, "Come on!" So I end up going downstairs to the, to the meal area--
Naked.
With a wet shirt on and wet socks.
Stevelaughs
I've got headache as it is. Meant to be a relaxing weekend.
Ricky laughs
That's it. But anyway, so we have our meal, which is really nice.
Candlelit?
Then we're sitting in the bar, I'm having a cigar by the fire. But we're having a rather nice Pinot Grigio. He's there go--
Is this 1955 that you live in?
(laughing) I know! (inaudible) We are knackered. 'cos er, you know - he's not used to work. I've seen him moaning falling asleep. He's not used to it at all.
Sure, and you get on your feet for her for over half an hour.

Yeah, right. So yeah, we didn't even walk around the gold course, we had a buggy. Wasn't even exercise! So we get into conversations, talking, like he's asking me stuff about evolution. What-about-why-tell-me-that, why did the giraffe... "what's that rubbish about the giraffe getting a long neck?" I said "well it didn't try and get a long neck".

"It was selected" and he said "but why would evolution do that?" - I went "Well you're thinking - evolution didn't do anything, there's not there's not this consciousness. There's not this will that a giraffe has to stretch its neck to reach the leaves, one had a long enough neck to survive and pass it on. He was going "Yeah, but why did he evolution?" - but, by the way, this isn't the most stupid thing. This is, this is warming up. This is about quarter to nine. He said "why didn't evolution make a giraffe good at carpentry so it could build a ladder?"
Right... yeah. Okay. No, alright.
Okay, so he's thinkingm he's thinking around it, he's trying to. He's trying to pick holes in evolution.
Yeah.

We got onto - I said, "well yada yada" I was saying umm, erm "we can see the speed of evolution in and lower life forms like bacteria, viruses - they evolved and that's why soon we won't have an antibiotic that didn't kill some certain bacterial strains" and HE said - and this is about half 11 then I said "I'm going to bed ".
HE said "In the future, they reckon that well be able to wake up and eat a yogurt you can have a chat with".
(laughs) I don't know what that means!
Look, lets put on a song on alright.
So you're going to explain that? You've got an explanation?
Yeah.
The Verve - Sonnet
The Verve, Sonnet on Xfm 104.9 I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington.
So let's just get this right. What did Karl say?

He said "they reckon" and he-he-he I said "I'm going to bed". He went "no really", and I said "No I'm going to bed karl, there's no point now because" uh, it' just like "you're talking gobbledygook". You don't mean? I might as well talk to a pot plant plan. He said "In the future, they reckon" -
I don't know who "they" are. I don't know... people who post things on the internet that he reads.
Nah, it was in The Telegraph.
Anyway complete the sentence.

"They reckon the in the future you'll be able to wake up" - I love that there's always a little scenario, an embellishment like this little (whistling) "yawm, hello darling here's your jogurt" - "helloooh". "You'll be able to wake up and eat a yogurt, you can have a chat with"
All right, well - you know. Thanks for that Rick. I'm gonna throw that over to Karl now.
It's when I was away on holiday, right? I got. I don't normally buy The Telegraph...
Too big and that, isn't it? So, but, they were giving it away for free on the plane. So I thought...
Ding dong!

Might as well have it. And I saw a couple of things and I thought "that would be interesting". I saw this thing about the future and it was talking about evolution and what have you - right which I always find weird because I always think that - maybe we've sort of done it wrong anyway. You know what I mean? I sometimes think...
It can't... by definition. Evolution can't get things wrong.
Hmmm...
Things change that it's not successful at, can't pass on its uhh genetic material.
Genetic material or that but... if you're around it's working, if you're around it's working. Slugs are as evolved as they need to be, slugs are as evolved as you... and me.
Well that's true enough!
Yeah, yeah! No disrespect but it works.
Sorry but what's your point Karl?
No I mean I think we probably would have been better off staying as a fish.
*laughs*
Just because there's more water than land, 'int there?
Right.
And we wouldn't drown...
This is why i went to bed
No I can imagine, I'm thinking of dozing off now.
Yeah *laughs*
No but it went- d'you know what I mean? From-
C'mon talk.
It was bacteria, it was fish, mermaid, man
*laughs*
Onward and what have ya.
*laughs* Oh god! Oh god! There are a few knowledge gaps in your theory of evolution.
You generally got it right though.
Basically yeah. It went bacteria, fish, mermaid, man. Ummm, what's next is the big question!

So it was tellin' you all about this and what have you, and sayin' how like we shouldn't have interfered 'cause maybe if we wouldnt't have invented planes and what 'ave ye maybe we'd be able to fly and what 'ave ye-
Sure, yeah.
If we really needed to and stuff like that.
Yeah, okay.
So we've interfered with evolution y'see?
Right.
But then it was sayin' well whats the future got?

Well yes in one way we have interfered with evolution yeah. The evolution of the human being in society is changing, it's not- it's no longer based on the strongest or the fittest because medical science can keep us alive long enough. People can pass on their genetic material, where without this civilisation, they wouldn't have been able to. So yeah, um it- it's- there are different parameters, there are different pressures, there are different things that say whether we're gonna pass on our genertic material or not, okay? So in that sense you're right.
And that , Rick. As far as I'm aware, has led to a yoghurt you can eat and have a conversation with.
So this is what it was sayin' it was just sayin' y'know we're livin' in mad times and that, y'know, there's a lot of weird stuff goin' on.
One of which is:
And the fella was just sayin' uh y'know with computers and stuff like that the way it is, uh, we'll be able to wake up...
Go on
'ave a chat with your yoghurt and 'ave something to eat.
What do you mean have a chat with your yoghurt?!
Because of the amount of- I mean, you have them yoghurts already, those friendly yoghurts. Those bacteria friendly ones, so this is just a really friendly one.
Yeah they don't- *laughs* oh God! I might burst! Do you know what? Sometimes Karl I think we're having a chat with a yoghurt. There can't be any difference!
Yeah but then I'm always reminded that would be more entertaining, that would be more informative.
U2 - city of blinding lights, I'm gonna see them next week, at Twickenham.
Well enjoy that.
Looking forward to it.
Thanks again for letting me know about your uh-
Old nobo and edge and all that. Now listen. You just got an email there saying  "can you turn up your microphone Steve"
Apparently my voice is a little bit quiet.
Karl has to do one thing, make sure we're heard, that's all he has to do.
Well I can hear him. Sounds fine to me.
Hmm well not to the listeners and that's who we're trying to please
Yeah.
One person so they can't even.
Yes, but we've only got one listener, so if he's not happy we're buggered.
(laughs) You allowed to say buggered?
Umm, hmm.
Not twice certainly.
No.
Once could have been a mistake.
Yeah
Twice, pointing it out, is definitely, yeah, complaint material.
Now, Karl. Karl. You haven't told us about your holiday yet. You were meant to do it last week and you didn't.
Uhh.
He started telling us but we didn't have time, 'cause we had to do monkey news about a monkey who was a director who cared about lighting and stuff.
Is there more monkeys news this week?
Yep.
It it where? Ahh, okay, is there, is it real monkey news? Did it happen or is it mostly embellishment in your round, little head?
Its proper stuff. Proper stuff, its proper stuff.
Yep. Okay good. So holiday, where did you go on holiday?
Uhh, Sardinia.
Good?
Yeah, it's alright, yeah. Ahh, nice food an' that. Its important innit?
Yeah
And nice beaches and what have you. I always like a nice, long beach to walk down.
Yeah
But ahh, so we're having a nice walk, right. You know how ahh, nudists do me head in?
Sure.
Right.

Not a problem though is it? It's not like being scared of spiders where they might jump out under the chicken, 'chicken sink?' Kitchen sink at you. You know what I mean. It's not a big problem having your head done in by nudists.
Yeah, but it's just, it just annoys me. It's sort of ruins the day a little bit, 'cause it, it, it makes me uncomfortable.
Right, take clothes off if you feel uncomfortable. That's much more relaxing.
Yeah, but. Well anyway right so I'm walking along the beach, right. Lovely, long beach and what have you. You know, watching the sea, picking up shells and that. Looking at...
Now what are your? What are you wearing? What's your natural beach clobber?

When he say picking up shells I imagine he's like on all fours, going, "ongh, ongh." Like that, you know what I mean, like looking at things. Just like, washing his nuts in the sea, to, to get, to get 'em tasty.
Yeah, going into the sea and then kind of shaking himself and all the water flies off.
(laughs)
I just got you know, flip-flops on, pair of shorts...
Bit noisy flip-flops.
And a, and like a little, a little light shirt.
Sure.
So anyway, walking along and ahh, Suzanne goes, "Oh look." All right. And there's this woman. German I think. Ahh, coming out of the...
How could you tell she was German? Underarm hair?
Well I'll get to it. Forget the underarm hair.
(Laughs)
She came out, it looked like she was smuggling seaweed, right.
(laughs hysterically) I'm going to burst. I am going to burst. Oh god.
And the, the funny thing is, right. She ahh.
Smuggling seaweed. Oh god. She was a bit hairy down there was she?

She, She ahh. It... Mental. I felt bad cause I hadn't had a shave for two days. Right, looked at her. Just, it was ridiculous. She might as well have kept her trunks on. It was just like she was wearing furry trunks, right. So anyway. So, I'm walking along. So.
Yeah, go on then.
So Suzanne's like, "Look" and I'm like, "Oh, not again."
You know cause every time we go away there seems to be one of these
Is she by herself, this woman?

Well, the weird thing was she was with her husband, right, but he had shorts on, he's happy, right. But every time, like, cause I walked past 'er and he sort of ran off, 'cause he's, he's embarrassed. Do you know what I mean? Cause there's nothing normal about it. What can he do? He can't go like "alright mate"? 'Cause he knows it's, it's odd. Right.
How old was he? Sorry, how old was she?
It's hard to tell when someone hasn't got clothes on.
Sure
You know, I mean, it's... they, they always look older don't they, when, when they haven't got clothes on
Anyway, but I'd say she was about... 40? 41?
Okay, right.

So um.. so yeah, so I walked passed, and the annoying thing is, sh- she got there on a bike. Right? No clothes on, little pair of boots... next to the bike. So you can wear boots just pop some shorts on, you know what I mean? That takes more effort, for me, putting boots on. So put the shorts on.
Right
So anyway, the husband kept running off. I walked past and, and I'm getting annoyed, 'cause I'm saying we've got to walk past them again on the way back.
I like the way they're scuttling away when Karl walks past, like when you lift up a bit of, sort of iron sheeting in the woods and loads of mice run away.
Yeah.
It's like whenever Karl goes that nudists run away.
Nudes- yeah.
Okay.
But no, so, so, we sort of come walking back and what have you and, and, you know, I have a- another look and what have you
Why are you having a look, why are you having another look if it offends you so much?
Well... you might as well just... just have a look, you know what I mean, if she's putting it on show and what have you, but the interesting thing was that I just wondered whether the husband...

If the husband would have been nude you would have looked at his tackle, 'cause you remember when you went to see those two strippers and it was a woman and man, and they whip their shorts off, you said you looked at his tackle first.
I think any bloke would.
Well...
You would, you just check it out, it's natural innit, you just go, oh right..
Go on then
Everything's normal or whatever. Because you don't know.. do you know what I mean, if what you've gots right until you've seen someone else's.
Ricky laughs
Do you know what I mean?
Yeah, go on
Anyway, so um, but he got us talking 'cause I was, then, as soon as I saw her, sort of, day's been ruined a bit. So I'm walking on the beach
Day's been ruined!

Walking up the beach with Suzanne going "How does it happen"? Do you know what I mean? "Why do people do this"? "What's, what's, what fun are they getting out of it?" And what have you, and um, I just was thinking, is there any chance that that fella, right, didn't even know.
That she was a nudist until they went away?
Do you know what I mean? 'Cause I said to Suzanne if... Say if I met Susan it's like we're getting on, yeah, everything's fine.
Yeah
And then you go off on holiday, and you go "You haven't got much, uh, luggage".
Steve laughs
Ricky laughs
And she's like "No, no this is fine, this is plenty". And I'm thinking "that's weird". And then we go down the beach and she whips her knickers off.
Steve laughs
I'd, I'd be annoyed, but there's nothing I could do. Do you know what I mean?
Sure.
So I'm just wondering whether that's what happened to this fella. Every time someone came walking up he was like, "oh God, this is embarrassing", and he kept nipping off.
Yeah
Finding something else to do
Look at some shells
Steve laughs

I'm wondering Rick, it at some point, maybe today or in future shows, we should get a nudist. You know, one of those official nudist spokespeople, you know, because there's all these nudists organizations, get 'em on the phone, justify themselves to Karl, because you know... in, in his mind they are... What would you say, weirdos, freaks?
I just don't... I don't quite get it. I was reading something in one of the supplements last weekend, and some journalists went round to some, uh... whatever you call it some... resort
Or whatever for- for nudes and that.
A nudist colony, sure.
And it's just, that-
Were they playing volleyball?
Well, the annoying thing was... bowls.
Ricky Laughs
Why is that annoying?
Well, don't play a sport where you've gotta bend over.
Ricky Laughs
Neil Young - Pardon My Heart
Neil Young, from the album Zuma, and that's, uh, Pardon My Heart.
Beautiful

On XFM 104.9, Ricky Gervais, Stephen Merchant, Karl Pilkington. We've just had an E- a text here that says, and I don't know what truth there is in this, as ever, but John says there is apparently a "nude bike ride" today in Hyde Park.
Ricky Groans
Now, I can't believe that's the case because I don't think it's allowed, is it? You can't ride around with your... your veg out can you?
I don't know. I don't know.
Why would you want to?
Well... it's a good point.
On a bike.
Steve Laughs
"On a bike."  I love the fact that that's what disgusts him.

Whoever I- I- I want- do you know what? If we did appeal for a nudist to call in? I'd want a very specific sort. I don't want a little- I want- I want a German nudist. A middle-aged man called Helmut.
Okay.
If there is any- or the closest one to it. So I want a middle-aged man from Germany, if your name is Helmut you're in, but I'll accept... I'll accept Hans, uhm... Carl would be good, wouldn't it?
Okay. All right.
Yeah?
I think, I'm- I'm wondering if the age might... maybe we could- could we- could we broaden that a little bit?
Okay, just a German- a German nudist bloke.
Right.
Could he at least be fat?
Steve Laughs
Okay.
Could I find a fat German fella? If your name's Helmut we're gonna give you a big prize.
Yeah.
But, you know, any fat German fella who likes to get his sausage out.
Sure.
Okay?
His "sauerkraut."
Yeah.
What's the phone number?
Uh, oh eight seven one, triple two, one oh four nine. It would be good just to get an email or a text over the contact, wouldn't it?
Okay.
And then I can just call them up in the week.
Sure.
And, uh...

Eighty three nine three six is the, uh, text number. I think- I mean, I don't know what our, uhm, our audience demographic pans out like, Rick, but I'm suspecting that's probably a fairly small fraction of our listenership, the, uh...
I know, but you know.
The fat German nudists.
There must be someone out there. If you know a fat German who likes to get his tackle out- the phones are going. Phones go-
Straight away. Straight away.
Just answer it, Karl. Just answer it. Just- pot luck. Just-
No, cause it could be anything.
Well let's just see what it is!
